passages.1:1: {After}<note: Literally "And it happened after"> the death of Saul, David returned from defeating the Amalekites and he stayed at Ziklag two days.
passages.1:2: On the third day, a man came from the camp from [being with] Saul, with his clothes torn and with dirt on his head. {When he came}<note: Literally "And it happened at his coming"> to David, he fell to the ground and bowed down.
passages.1:3: David said to him, "Where did you come from?" He said to him, "I have escaped from the camp of Israel."
passages.1:4: Then David said to him, "{How did things go}?<note: Literally "What [was] the thing"> Please tell me." He answered, "{When}<note: Literally "That"> the army fled from the battle, and many of the people fell; also, Saul and Jonathan his son died."
passages.1:5: Then David asked the young man who [was] reporting to him, "How do you know that Saul and his son Jonathan died?"

passages.1:7: When he turned around and saw me, he called to me, and I said, 'Here I [am].'
passages.1:8: Then he said to me, 'Who [are] you?' And I said to him, 'I [am] an Amalekite.'
passages.1:9: He said to me, 'Please stand over me and kill me, for convulsions have seized me, even though my life [is still] in me.'

passages.1:11: David grabbed [at] his clothes and tore them, [as did] all of the men who [were] with him.
passages.1:12: Then they mourned and wept and fasted over Saul and Jonathan his son until the evening, [as well] as over the people of Yahweh and over the house of Israel because they had fallen by the sword.
passages.1:13: Then David said to the young man who [was] reporting to him, "Where [are] you from?" And he said, "I [am] the son of an alien man. I [am] an Amalekite."
passages.1:14: David said to him, "How [is it that] you [were] not afraid to stretch out your hand to destroy Yahweh's anointed one?"
passages.1:15: Then David called to one of the young men and said to him, "Come near; strike him." So he struck him down and he died.
passages.1:16: David said to him, "Your blood [is] on your head, for your mouth has testified against you by saying, 'I killed Yahweh's anointed one!'"
passages.1:17: Then David sang this funeral song over Saul and over Jonathan his son.
passages.1:18: And he ordered "The Bow" to be taught to the children of Judah. Look, it [is] written on the scroll of Jashar.<note: The Book of Jashar ("the upright") is also mentioned in Josh 10:13.>
passages.1:19: "The glory of Israel [is] on your high places; how [the] mighty have fallen!

passages.2:1: It happened after this that David inquired of Yahweh, saying, "Shall I go up into one of the cities of Judah?" And Yahweh said to him, "Go up." David asked, "Where shall I go up?" And he said, "To Hebron."

passages.2:29: Then Abner and his men went through the Arabah all that night, and they crossed over the Jordan. They went all the forenoon and came to Mahanaim.

passages.10:10: The rest of the army he placed into the hand of his brother Abishai, who {arranged them in battle lines}<note: Literally "arrayed"> to meet the {Ammonites}.<note: Literally "sons/children of Ammon">
